body_html:
Since you republished it on Reddit, I'll also chime in.

GPL was a good move in 200X, but not anymore.
Nowadays with the wealth of open-source software GPL will hurt adoption, especially for binaries that will be linked to.

I'm working full-time as an open-source dev and GPL-only or LGPL-only are basically banned from my company. I even opened an issue 2 months ago to Facebook's RocksDB to be clear on the GPL licensing: facebook/rocksdb#3417.

body:
Since you republished it on Reddit, I'll also chime in.

GPL was a good move in 200X, but not anymore.
Nowadays with the wealth of open-source software GPL will hurt adoption, especially for binaries that will be linked to.

I'm working full-time as an open-source dev and GPL-only or LGPL-only are basically banned from my company. I even opened an issue 2 months ago to Facebook's RocksDB to be clear on the GPL licensing: https://github.com/facebook/rocksdb/issues/3417.
